title: 820-00138 fast fans
message:
Arrived with fans running fast. No liquid damage. Tried replacement heatsink, good known trackpad and trackpad cable but no changes.

Apple diagnostic says problem might be with the SMC and HW monitor says heatpipe #2 is 128C

What should be tried next???

title: 820-00138 fast fans
message: Also noticed both heatsinks never feel hot to the touch

title: 820-00138 fast fans
message:
Try known good trackpad flex/board.
Inspect Q5803 and U5860 areas.

title: 820-00138 fast fans
message:
This board is pristine looking with no liquid damage all around.

Using a 820-00426 boardview. 820-00138 is still not available correct?

What should be checked or measured next?

title: 820-00138 fast fans
message:
00163 boardview may help also.

Try disconnecting RIO flex (J9510).
Check continuity from U5860/70 to their corresponding temp sensors.

title: 820-00138 fast fans
message:
u5870 continuity is good. u5860 does not exist in boardview

disconnecting RIO flex had no change.

title: 820-00138 fast fans
message:
Unfortunatelly, the boardview is not for this model.
However, U5860 has an internal sensor and should be placed close to left fin stack, on top side (SMC side); as per schematic mention.
Search for Q5803 near the right fin stack.

title: 820-00138 fast fans
message:
Found U5860 top left side of board (SMC side)

Replaced but still no change. Also checked all surrounding resistors.

title: 820-00138 fast fans
message:
"Search for Q5803 near the right fin stack."
Good traces???

title: 820-00138 fast fans
message: HWMonitor shows only one temp error?

title: 820-00138 fast fans
message: just heatpipeoutgoing air and airport proximity

title: 820-00138 fast fans
message: Correct boardview should be available in XinZhiZao.

title: 820-00138 fast fans
message:
Airport temperature is sensed by U5823.
Inspect for corrosion, resolder it and check R5822.
If still the same, remove it and test the machine again.

title: 820-00138 fast fans
message: Solved. Still fast fan when u5823 was removed but back to normal speed once U5823 replaced
